title: 107_s1733
content: The Act titled "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001" establishes an interoperable law enforcement and intelligence data system with name matching capacity and training. The Act "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001" mandates the development of a unified electronic data system by key government agencies to facilitate visa issuance and alien admissibility determinations. The system must have name search capacity, linguistic sensitivity, user support, and private sector consultation. The unified electronic database mandated by the "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001" must have linguistically sensitive searches using algorithms that account for variations in name formats and transliterations. It should also provide user support, be developed in consultation with private sector firms, utilize commercially available platforms, and be continuously adjusted and improved based on experience and advancements in technology and sciences. The unified electronic data system mandated by the "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001" must incorporate advanced linguistic, mathematical, statistical, and anthropological research methods. Linguistically sensitive algorithms for at least 4 high-priority languages will be developed. Adequate user support will include information on names in different languages and a means to communicate with experts. Interim reports will be provided every 6 months. The "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001" mandates a unified electronic data system incorporating advanced research methods. Linguistically sensitive algorithms for high-priority languages will be developed, with user support for communicating with experts. Interim reports on implementation progress will be submitted every 6 months, along with reports by intelligence agencies on specific timelines for completing surveys and issuing guidelines. The Director of Intelligence will issue guidelines and consult with various agencies in developing a data system under the "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001". Appropriations are authorized for this purpose, and the system will utilize established technology standards. The data system established under the "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001" will have information accessible to Foreign Service officers issuing visas and Federal agents determining alien admissibility. Procedures will be in place to restrict access to intelligence information in certain circumstances.
